Today is Equal Pay Day ‚Äî the date symbolizing how far women must work on average to earn what men earned during the previous year.

But it's not the full story.

Racism, sexism, & lack of economic opportunity exacerbate the pay gap for women of color.

Take a look at the numbers: https://twitter.com/ACLU/status/1245046298388172801 QT @ACLU Today is #EqualPayDay, when the average woman‚Äôs pay catches up to the pay for all men from the previous year. It means that women, on average, have to work an additional three months to make as much money as men, on average.

Here‚Äôs how the pay gap breaks down: http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EUdKmxZWkAEn6zw.jpg

Each year women & families lose $935 billion b/c we don‚Äôt have #EqualPay. 
 
The House passed the #PaycheckFairness Act in March 2019 ‚Äì well before #COVID19. It‚Äôs time for the Senate to do the same so that all families are covered during the pandemic & beyond!
 
#EqualPayDay http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EUewx_hX0AAd6Gi.jpg
